issuesAndSolutions.issue_name: This is added by Swathi for testing
This is added by GP for testing
If the banner image is sliced into multiple parts to give different links for the same image a white line will appear in between the sliced images

solutions.solution: To resolve this we need to wrap the images to a div like <div align="right" style="font-size: 0; line-height: 0;"> </div> and for all images inside that div this style needs to be added style="margin:0;border:none;" and align="left"

issuesAndSolutions.issue_name: In Gmail App extra white line will appear at the footer section
In Windows 10 Mail, a blue line may occur before the Map image
Southeastern Railway – Making the Map Image’s background as White and to the standard width and height
Southeastern Railway – Rendering issue may occur in shadow image(Top and bottom)

solutions.solution: Replace the existing images with proper shadow images both top and bottom.

issuesAndSolutions.issue_name: In Windows 10 Mail, the texts which are hyperlinked will get underlined

solutions.solution: Check the solution in here

issuesAndSolutions.issue_name: In Windows 10 Mail, background images/spacer images wont get display
Follow Us or Get social text in the footer part will not render correctly
In some creative, only the images will display but the text part will be missed
If the creative contains bullet points, we will notice the alignment  issue in some domains
In Yahoo domain (FF & Chrome) the creative will be completely left aligned

solutions.solution:
Check if the contents table has the 100% wrapper table. If it is there just add align="center" attribute to the contents table and the td which holds the contents table. If it is not there we need to create one with center aligned contents table like below 


<!-- wrapper table -->

<table width="100%" border="0" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0">

<tbody>

<tr>

<td align="center" valign="top">

<!-- conent table -->

  <table width="600" border="0" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" align="center">

  <tbody>

  <tr>

  <td valign="top">Here goes the actual contents</td>

  </tr>

  </tbody>

  </table>

<!-- conent table ends -->  

</td>

</tr>

</tbody>

</table>

<!-- wrapper table ends -->

issuesAndSolutions.issue_name: White line will appear in the header part in Windows 10 Mail domain
If footer section contains “Unsubscribe from M-Ticketing” it will not display correctly
There will be double border in the Footer section after 3rd module and before Social Bar
Rendering Issue in the CTA button
Round corner border is missing in the Right side of the Proof
Date/time, address and phone number highlighting/underlining issue in Windows 10 Mail App

solutions.solution:
This will stop windows 10 Mail app from highlighting the Date/time , Address and Phone numbers
Note: This won't resolve the issue entirely this will remove the color highlights, but the dotted underline will be there

To avoid the Windows 10 Mail App address and phone number highlighting add the meta tag <meta name="format-detection" content="telephone=no"> and the following styles in the conditional comments for MS Outlook versions greater than 2016 in head section
Note: Here the conditional styles should be added before the closing head tag

<!--[if gt mso 15]>
<style type="text/css">
/*Windows 10 phone link fix*/
a:link, span.MsoHyperlink {
mso-style-priority:100 !important;
color:inherit !important;
text-decoration:none !important;
}
</style>
<![endif]-->

To remove underline to all the linked texts the following style should be added to the style tag in the head section
Note: Before doing the below steps make sure to add the syle text-decoration:underline; to all links which should come with underline.

a { text-decoration:none; }

Finally the head section should look like below

<head>
<meta charset="utf-8">
<meta name="format-detection" content="telephone=no">
<title>Untitled Document</title>
<style type="text/css">
body { font-family: arial; font-size: 14px; width: 80%; margin: 10px auto; }
.page-title { background-color: lightgrey; padding: 10px; border-radius: 5px; }
.text-center { text-align: center; }
code { padding: 10px; background-color: lightblue; display: block; }
span.code-highlight { background-color: yellow; }
a[href^="x-apple-data-detectors:"] { color: inherit; text-decoration: inherit; }
a[x-apple-data-detectors] { color: inherit !important; text-decoration: none !important; font-size: inherit !important; font-family: inherit !important; font-weight: inherit !important; line-height: inherit !important; }
a { text-decoration:none; }
</style>

<!-- Outlook specific codes goes here -->
<!--[if gt mso 14]>
<style type="text/css">
/* Hight issue fix for greaer than MS Outlook 2013*/
.height_01, #height_01 {
font-size:1px;
line-height:1px;
}
</style>
<![endif]-->
<!--[if gt mso 15]>
<style type="text/css">
/*Windows 10 phone link fix*/
a:link, span.MsoHyperlink {
mso-style-priority:100 !important;
color:inherit !important;
text-decoration:none !important;
}
</style>
<![endif]-->
</head>

issuesAndSolutions.issue_name: Content Expanded beyond the width of the wrapper table in Android 4.4 devices becasue of lengthy links

solutions.solution:
This issue will come when the link text is present in the actual contents of the email like

To avoid this issue we need to add word-wrap and word-break style to the anchor tag

issuesAndSolutions.issue_name: Date/time, address and phone number highlighting/underlining issue in Apple devices

solutions.solution:
This will eliminate the blue+underline styling (tested on iPhone 5, iOS 8.3) [Source StakOverflow]

To remove the iphone address and phone number highlighting add the following code to the head tag in HTML creative

a[href^="x-apple-data-detectors:"] {
color: inherit;
text-decoration: inherit;
}

and

a[x-apple-data-detectors] {
color: inherit !important;
text-decoration: none !important;
font-size: inherit !important;
font-family: inherit !important;
font-weight: inherit !important;
line-height: inherit !important;
}

Before adding the above code to style tag, make sure to add this meta tag to the head section

<meta name="format-detection" content="telephone=no">

Here is the screenshot of rendering issue and the resolved one

The image with the issue

The image with the issue resolved
